purpose: The email announces the Call for Papers for the 44th International Conference on Conceptual Modeling (ER 2025), scheduled for October 20-23, 2025, in Poitiers, France. It invites contributions on the theme 'Building Trust Through Conceptual Modeling,' emphasizing the importance of trust in digital ecosystems. The conference seeks original research, industry reports, and vision papers related to conceptual modeling, with specific submission guidelines and important dates provided. The email also outlines the review process and topics of interest for submissions, highlighting the role of conceptual modeling in various applications and the need for ethical standards.

evidence_sentences: This yearâ€™s theme focuses on the important role conceptual modeling plays in creating systems that are trustworthy, inclusive, and transparent.

We invite the Conceptual Modelling community to deliberate on how traditional modeling principles and frameworks can contribute and adapt to new advancements in AI, data ecosystems, and autonomous platforms while upholding ethical standards and fostering trust in digital innovations.

We welcome submissions of original research on a variety of topics on conceptual modeling, including well-established and emerging areas of research and practice, as well as submissions that lead to new foundations, links, applications, or enlarge current boundaries of conceptual modeling.
Each paper admitted to the review process will be reviewed by at least two program committee members.
The authors of selected papers will be invited to prepare a substantially revised and extended version of a Special Issue in Elsevier's Data & Knowledge Engineering.
